title: The One With The Sonogram at the End

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What you guys don't understand is, for us, kissing is as important as any part of it.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, right!.......Y'serious?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Everything you need to know is in that first kiss.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Absolutely.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, I think for us, kissing is pretty much like an opening act, y'know? I mean it's like the stand-up comedian you have to sit through before Pink Floyd comes out.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, and-and it's not that we don't like the comedian, it's that-that... that's not why we bought the ticket.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: The problem is, though, after the concert's over, no matter how great the show was, you girls are always looking for the comedian again, y'know? I mean, we're in the car, we're fighting traffic... basically just trying to stay awake.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, well,

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: WORD OF ADVICE Bring back the comedian. Otherwise next time you're gonna find yourself sitting at home, listening to that album alone.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (pause)....Are we still talking about sex?

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Museum of Prehistoric History, Ross and a co-worker
(Marsha) are setting up an exhibit which includes some mannequins of cave people.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, it's good, it is good, it's just that- mm- doesn't she seem a little angry?

dialogue.speaker: MARSHA
dialogue.text: Well, she has issues.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Does she.

dialogue.speaker: MARSHA
dialogue.text: He's out banging other women over the head with a club, while she sits at home trying to get the mastodon smell out of the carpet!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Marsha, these are cave people. Okay? They have issues like 'Gee, that glacier's getting kinda close.' See?

dialogue.speaker: MARSHA
dialogue.text: Speaking of issues, isn't that your ex-wife?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (trying to ignore her) No. No.

dialogue.speaker: MARSHA
dialogue.text: Yes, it is. Carol! Hi!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, yes, it is. (waves) How about I'll, uh, catch up with you in the Ice Age.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: So.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You look great. I, uh... I hate that.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Sorry. You look good too.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah, well, in here, anyone who... stands erect... So what's new? Still, uh...

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: A lesbian?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well... you never know. How's, um.. how's the family?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Marty's still totally paranoid. Oh, and, uh-

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why- why are you here, Carol?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: I'm pregnant.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Pregnant?!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Museum of Prehistoric History, Ross and a co-worker
(Marsha) are setting up an exhibit which includes some mannequins of cave people.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Joey, Phoebe, and Monica are watching Three's
Company .]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, I think this is the episode of Three's Company where there's some kind of misunderstanding.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: ...Then I've already seen this one! (Turns off the TV.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (taking a drink from Joey) Are you through with that?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, sorry, the swallowing slowed me down.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Whose little ball of paper is this?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, uh, that would be mine. See, I wrote a note to myself, and then I realised I didn't need it, so I balled it up and... (sees that Monica is glaring at him) ...now I wish I was dead.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: She's already fluffed that pillow... Monica, you know, you've already fluffed that- (Monica glares at her.) -but, it's fine!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Look , I'm sorry, guys, I just don't wanna give them any more ammunition than they already have.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, and we all know how cruel a parent can be about the flatness of a child's pillow.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Monica- Hi! Um, Monica, you're scaring me. I mean, you're like, you're like all chaotic and twirly. And not-not in a good way.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, calm down. You don't see Ross getting all chaotic and twirly every time they come.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That's because as far as my parents are concerned, Ross can do no wrong. Y'see, he's the Prince. Apparently they had some big ceremony before I was born.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (looking out the window) Ew, ew, ew, ew ew ew ew ew!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ugly Naked Guy got a Thighmaster!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Eeaagh!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Has anybody seen my engagement ring?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's beautiful.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh God, oh God, oh God oh God oh God oh God.... (Starts to look under the couch cushions.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, look, don't touch that!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, like I wasn't dreading tomorrow enough, having to give it back to him... 'Hi Barry! Remember me? I'm the girl in the veil who stomped on your heart in front of your entire family!' Oh God and now I'm gonna have to return the ring, without the ring, which makes it so much harder...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Easy Rach, we'll find it. (To all) Won't we!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh! Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Alright, when'd'ya have it on last?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Doy! Probably right before she lost it!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You don't get a lot of 'doy' these days...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know I had it this morning, and I know I had it when I was in the kitchen with...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...Dinah?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (looks at the lasagne and realizes something) Ohhhhh, don't be mad...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You didn't.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I am sorry...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I gave you one job! (Starts to examin the lasagne through the bottom of the glass pan.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, but look how straight those noodles are!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Now, Monica, you know that's not how you look for an engagement ring in a lasagne...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (puts down the lasagne) I just... can't do it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Boys? We're going in.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (standing outside the door).....Hi.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow. That is not a happy hi.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Carol's pregnant.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (while everyone else is stunned) Ooh! I found it!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah. Do that for another two hours, you might be where I am right about now. (He enters.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Kinda puts that whole pillow thing in perspective, huh, Mon?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well now, how-how do you fit into this whole thing?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, Carol says she and Susan want me to be involved, but if I'm not comfortable with it, I don't have to be involved.. basically it's entirely up to me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: She is so great! I miss her.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What does she mean by 'involved'?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I mean presumably, the biggest part of your job is done.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Anyway, they want me to go down to this- sonogram thing with them tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So what are you gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I have no idea. No matter what I do, though, I'm still gonna be a father.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: .....Well, this is still ruined, right?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Oh, Martha Ludwin's daughter is gonna call you. (Tastes a snack) Mmm! What's that curry taste?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Curry.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Mmmm!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I- I think they're great! I, I really do.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: (To Ross) Do you remember the Ludwins? The big one had a thing for you, didn't she?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: They all had a thing for him.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Aw, Mom...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, why is this girl going to call me?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Oh, she just graduated, and she wants to be something in cooking, or food, or.... I don't know. Anyway, I told her you had a restaurant-

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No Mom, I don't have a restaurant, I work in a restaurant.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Well, they don't have to know that... (She starts to fluff the same pillow Monica fluffed multiple times earlier.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ross, could you come and help me with the spaghetti, please?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah. (They go to the kitchen.)

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Oh, we're having spaghetti! That's.... easy.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know this is going to sound unbelievably selfish, but, were you planning on bringing up the whole baby/lesbian thing? Because I think it might take some of the heat off me.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: What that Rachel did to her life.... We ran into her parents at the club, they were not playing very well.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: I'm not gonna tell you what they spent on that wedding... but forty thousand dollars is a lot of money!

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Well, at least she had the chance to leave a man at the altar...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Nothing! It's an expression.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No it's not.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Don't listen to your mother. You're independent, and you always have been! Even when you were a kid... and you were chubby, and you had no friends, you were just fine! And you would read alone in your room, and your puzzles...

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Look, there are people like Ross who need to shoot for the stars, with his museum, and his papers getting published. Other people are satisfied with staying where they are- I'm telling you, these are the people who never get cancer.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: ...And I read about these women trying to have it all, and I thank God 'Our Little Harmonica' doesn't seem to have that problem.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (trying desperately to change the subject) So, Ross, what's going on with you? Any stories? (Digs her elbow into his hand.) No news, no little anecdotes to share with the folks?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (pulls his hand away) Okay! Okay. (To his parents) Look, I, uh- I realise you guys have been wondering what exactly happened between Carol and me, and, so, well, here's the deal. Carol's a lesbian. She's living with a woman named Susan. She's pregnant with my child, and she and Susan are going to raise the baby.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: (To Monica) And you knew about this?!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Joey, Phoebe, and Monica are watching Three's
Company .]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Your folks are really that bad, huh?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, y'know, these people are pros. They know what they're doing, they take their time, they get the job done.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Boy, I know they say you can't change your parents,... boy, if you could- (To Ross) -I'd want yours.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Must pee. (Goes to pee.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Y'know, it's even worse when you're twins.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You're twins?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah. We don't speak. She's like this high-powered, driven career type.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What does she do?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: She's a waitress.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right, you guys, I kinda gotta clean up now. (They all start to leave.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Chandler, you're an only child, right? You don't have any of this.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, no, although I did have an imaginary friend, who... my parents actually preferred.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: The lights, please..

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...How long was I in there?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm just cleaning up.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: D'ya.. uh.. d'ya need any help?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh.. okay, sure! Thanks! (She hands him the broom and sits down.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Anyway.. um.. (Starts to sweep.) So, you- uh- you nervous about Barry tomorrow?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh.. a little..

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Mm-hmm..

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: A lot.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Mm.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So, got any advice? Y'know, as someone who's recently been- dumped?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, you may wanna steer clear of the word 'dumped'. Chances are he's gonna be this, this broken shell of a man, y'know, so you should try not to look too terrific, I know it'll be hard. Or, y'know, uh, hey!, I'll go down there, and I'll give Barry back his ring, and you can go with Carol and Susan to the OB/GYN...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, you've got Carol tomorrow.. When did it get so complicated?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Got me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Remember when we were in high school together?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I mean, didn't you think you were just gonna meet somone, fall in love- and that'd be it? (Ross gazes at her.) ..Ross?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, yes!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh! Man, I never thought I'd be here.. (She leans back onto his hand.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Me either... (He pulls up a stool so that he doesn't have to move his hand.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Sorry I'm late, I was stuck at work. There was this big dinosaur.. thing.. anyway.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ross, you remember Susan.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: How could I forget?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (they shake hands) Hello, Susan. (To Carol) Good shake. Good shake. So, uh, we're just waiting for...?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Dr. Oberman.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ..Dr. Oberman. Okay. And is he-

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: She.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: -she, of course, she- uh- familiar with our.. special situation?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Yes, and she's very supportive.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, that's great. (Susan gives her drink to Carol.) No, I'm- Oh.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (picks up a surgical instrament and mimes a duck with it) Quack, quack..

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ross? That opens my cervix. (He drops it in horror.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Barry?

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: C'mon in.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (hesitates) Are you sure?

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Yeah! It's fine, it's fine. Robbie's gonna be here for hours.

dialogue.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogue.text: Huh?!

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: So, how ya doin?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm- uh- I'm okay... You look great!

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Yeah, well..

dialogue.speaker: BERNICE
dialogue.text: (over intercom) Dr. Farber, Jason Greenstein's gagging.

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: (answering the intercom) Be right there. (To Robbie and Rachel) Be back in a sec.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I dumped him.

dialogue.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogue.text: Okay.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Carol's OB/GYN, they're talking about how this is going to work.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So, um- so how's this, uh, how's this gonna work? Y'know, with us? Y'know, when, like, important decisions have to be made?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Give me a 'for instance'.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, uh, uh, I don't know, okay, okay, how about with the, uh, with the baby's name?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Marlon-

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Marlon?!

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: -if it's a boy, Minnie if it's a girl.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...As in Mouse?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: As in my grandmother.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Still, you- you say Minnie, you hear Mouse. Um, how about, um.. how about Julia?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Julia..

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: We agreed on Minnie.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: 'S'funny, um, uh, we agreed we'd spend the rest of our lives together. Things change, roll with the punches. I believe Julia's on the table..?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Carol's OB/GYN, they're talking about how this is going to work.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Barry's office, Rachel is doing her makeup in the mirror on Barry's lamp as
Barry enters.]

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Sorry about that. So. What have you been up to?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, not much. I-I got a job.

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Oh, that's great.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Why are- why are you so tanned?

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Oh, I, uh- I went to Aruba.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh no. You went on our honeymoon alone?

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: No. I went with, uh.. Now, this may hurt.

dialogue.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogue.text: Me?!

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: No! (To Rachel) I went with Mindy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Mindy?! My maid of honour, Mindy?!

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, uh, we're kind of a thing now.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh! Well, um.. (Grabs his forehand) You've got plugs!

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Careful! They haven't quite taken yet.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And you've got lenses! But you hate sticking your finger in your eye!

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Not for her. Listen, I really wanted to thank you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay..

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: See, about a month ago, I wanted to hurt you. More than I've ever wanted to hurt anyone in my life. And I'm an orthodontist.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow.

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: You know, you were right? I mean, I thought we were happy. We weren't happy. But with Mindy, now I'm happy. Spit.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogue.text: Me. (Spits.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Anyway, um, (Gets the ring out of her purse.) I guess this belongs to you. And thank you for giving it to me.

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Well, thank you for giving it back.

dialogue.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogue.text: Hello?!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Barry's office, Rachel is doing her makeup in the mirror on Barry's lamp as
Barry enters.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Carol's OB/GYN, they're still arguing about what to name the baby.]

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Oh, please! What's wrong with Helen?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Helen Geller? I don't think so.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Hello? It's not gonna be Helen Geller.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thank you!

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: No, I mean it's not Geller.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What, it's gonna be Helen Willick?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: No, actually, um, we talked about Helen Willick-Bunch.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, wait a minute, wha- why is she in the title?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: It's my baby too.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, 's'funny, really? Um, I don't remember you making any sperm.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Yeah, and we all know what a challenge that is!

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: All right, you two, stop it!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No no no, she gets a credit, hey, I'm in there too.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ross. You're not actually suggesting Helen Willick-Bunch-Geller? 'Cause I think that borders on child abuse.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Of course not, I'm... suggesting Geller-Willick-Bunch.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Oh, no, nonononono, you see what he's doing? He knows no-one's gonna say all those names, so they'll wind up calling her Geller, then he gets his way!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: My way?! You-you think this is my way? Believe me, of all the ways I ever imagined this moment in my life being, this is not my way- y'know what? Uh, um, this is too hard. I'm not, I can't do-

dialogue.speaker: DR. OBERMAN
dialogue.text: (entering) Knock knock!How are we today? Any nausea?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah. Yeah. A little.

dialogue.speaker: DR. OBERMAN
dialogue.text: Well, I was just wondering about the mother-to-be, but.. thanks for sharing. (To Carol) Uh, lie back..

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You- uh- y'know what, I'm gonna go. I don't- I don't think I can be involved in this particular thing right now.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh my God.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Look at that.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: I know.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Carol's OB/GYN, they're still arguing about what to name the baby.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment, everyone is watching the tape of the sonogram.
  Rachel is on the phone.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well? Isn't that amazing?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What are we supposed to be seeing here?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I dunno, but.. I think it's about to attack the Enterprise.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You know, if you tilt your head to the left, and relax your eyes, it kinda looks like an old potato.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Then don't do that, alright?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (walks over to where Monica is standing)Monica. Whaddya think?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (welling up) Mm-hmm.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wh- are you welling up?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You are, you're welling up.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Am not!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You're gonna be an aunt.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (pushes him and starts to cry) Oh shut up!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on phone) Hi, Mindy. Hi, it-it's Rachel. Yeah, I'm fine. I-I saw Barry today. Oh, yeah, yeah he-he told me. No, no, it's okay. I hope you two are very happy, I really do. Oh, oh, and Mind, y'know, if-if everything works out, and you guys end up getting married and having kids- and everything- I just hope they have his old hairline and your old nose. (Slams the phone down.) (To everyone) Okay, I know it was a cheap shot, but I feel so much better now.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment, everyone is watching the tape of the sonogram.
  Rachel is on the phone.]
